AdditionalFields.Value: Prevention / Early Detection / Interception,Clinical Research,Cancer Disparities,Population Sciences

Description: It is remarkable that different categories of disease share common risk factors; effectively addressing these risks could have a major impact on global health. In this session, the public health impact of  tobacco use, obesity and suboptimal diets will be reviewed. In each area, recent advances in understanding of the biology of the risk factor will be reviewed, and this will inform a discussion of ways that disease risk can be reduced at the population level and the individual level.
SearchResultBody: SY28. Addressing Shared Risk Factors for Cancer, Cardiovascular Disease and Metabolic Disease
Title: Addressing Shared Risk Factors for Cancer, Cardiovascular Disease and Metabolic Disease
